page.curvetext:
What is a Virtual Organization?
What is a Virtual Organization?
page.enlisting:
◼ Virtual Organization consists of “a number of mutually distrustful participants with varying degrees of prior relationship (perhaps none at all) that want to share resources in order to perform some task.” - Ian Foster ◼ “A Virtual Organization (VO) is a collection of people (VO members), computing/storage resources (sites) and services (e.g., databases).” - from OSG About Page 9/27/2007 ◼ Virtual Organization consists of “a number of mutually distrustful participants with varying degrees of prior relationship (perhaps none at all) that want to share resources in order to perform some task.” - Ian Foster

page.title:
VOMRS Main Features VOMRS offers a comprehensive set of services that facilitates secure and authenticated management of VO membership, grid resource authorization and privileges: ◼
VOMRS Main Features
VOMRS offers a comprehensive set of services that facilitates secure
and authenticated management of VO membership, grid resource
authorization and privileges:
◼
page.normal_text:
implements a registration workflow providing means for collaborators to register with a Virtual Organization (VO) supports management of multiple grid certificates per member
implements a registration workflow providing means for collaborators to
register with a Virtual Organization (VO)
supports management of multiple grid certificates per member

page.title:
What a Member Needs To Know About VOMRS
What a Member Needs To Know About VOMRS
page.normal_text:
In order to access VOMRS a user is required to have a valid certificate whose CA is recognized by the VO. First, a user should register with VOMRS. Registration consists of two steps:
In order to access VOMRS a user is required to have a valid certificate
whose CA is recognized by the VO.
First, a user should register with VOMRS. Registration consists of two steps:
